name: European Network of Gynaecological Cancer Advocacy Groups
memberOrga: 70 group members (Patient organization and patient advocacy groups in gynaecological cancer in Europe)
goal:
ENGAGe is a network of gyneacological cancer patient advocacy groups functioning under the ESGO (European Society of Gynaecological Oncology) and the umbrella organisation in Europe striving to facilitate patient education and awareness about gynaecological cancers.
Whilst working closely with the ESGO which is the leading learning organization of healthcare professionals involved in the treatment and care of gynae oncological patients, this pan-European influence ensures the gynaecologial cancer patient perspective becomes integrated in the European gynaecological cancer voice.

ENGAGe objectives are:
 To facilitate the development of national gynecological cancer patient groups in Europe and to facilitate networking and collaboration between them
 To disseminate information and share best practices to empower patient groups and improve the quality of care across Europe
 To build public awareness and mobilize best care of women with gynaecological cancer at national and European levels.
 To increase patient representation in ESGO activities by education on current research and health policy.
 Advocate patient care policies, practices and access to appropriate care of both national and European levels
 To educate and build the capacity of patient groups, and facilitate their communication with health professionals, the public and health decision makers.
interests: Communication, Education and training, External Relations, Public Health
euInitiatives: Expert group on Cancer Control, Cancer screening and Prevention of Cancer
